Description: Painted wooden model group of two male figures, one tending a fire, the other kneading dough or grinding grain.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Published: W. Seipel, Ägypten Vol. 1, Linz 1989, p.104 [71]. S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p.37 [2].
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 228)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989 Apr-Sep, Linz, Oberosterreichisches Landesmuseum, Götter-Gräber und die Kunst-4000 Jahre altäg Jenseitsglaube 1990 20 Oct-9 Dec, Japan, Tokyo, Setagaya Art Museum, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.64 1991 5 Jan-20 Feb, Japan, Yamaguchi, Prefectural Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.64 1991 9 Mar-7 May, Japan, Osaka, National Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.64 1992 Jul-Oct, Norfolk, Swaffham Museum, Ancient Egypt 1997 13 Oct-1998 5 Jan, India, New Delhi, National Museum, The Enduring Image 1998 9 Feb-3 May, India, Mumbai, Sir Caswasjee Jahangir Hall, The Enduring Image 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2009 May-present, Newcastle, Great North Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
